text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Syrian newspapers on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- French President Jacques Chirac concludes a successful visit to Syria.
- The European Union refuses to be a mere paymaster in the Middle East peace process.
- France's Chirac calls for an Israeli withdrawal from the Golan Heights and South Lebanon and for the establishment of a Palestinian state.
- Syrian parliament speaker Abdulqadir Qaddoura and his Austrian counterpart Heinz Fischer discuss developments in the region and obstacles to the Middle East peace process.
- Syrian and French businessmen discuss the establishment of joint Syrian-French companies.
- The Lebanese resistance replies to Israeli aggression in South Lebanon by attacking three posts of the Israeli occupation forces and a patrol of their agents.
- Assistant secretary of the ruling Al-Baath party, Abdullah Al-Ahmar, receives an Egyptian parliament delegation and says Israel has led the peace process to a deadlock.
